title: Picasso v/s Imageloader v/s Fresco vs Glide
body:
Fresco link
(-)
- Huge size of library
- App freeze while loading big images from internet into ListView
- Huge size of cache
(+)
- Pretty fast image loader (for small && medium images)
- A lot of functionality


Picasso link
(-)
- Slow loading big images from internet into ListView
(+)
- Tinny size of library
- Small size of cache
- Simple in use
- UI is not freeze


Glide link
(official version for Java, not for Xamarin)
(-)
- ...
(+)
- Small size of library
- Tinny size of cache
- Simple in use
- GIF (animated image) support
- Fast loading big images from internet into ListView
- UI is not freeze


Tested by me on SGS2 (Android 4.1) (WiFi 8.43 Mbps)

For now I am using Glide.
Read more here.

You can write cache to External Storage (SD Card) with Glide.
